oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Battle of Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sketches; Civil War; Battle of Memphis; navy; Mississippi River; boats; 1860s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "The Battle of Memphis (June 6, 1862) looking South. After a Drawing by Rear-Admiral Walke." From the pages of "Operations of the Western Flotilla" by Henry Walke, Rear Admiral, United States Navy. Several vessels are identified, including Carondelet, Benton, St. Louis, Cairo, Louisville, Queen of the West, and Monarch.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Walke, Henry
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Illustrations from Harper's Weekly Newspaper and Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper
